whiff verb
(IN SPORT)
[ I ] US slang to try to hit a ball, puck, or person and miss completely : He took a wild swing and whiffed badly.
[ T ] US slang In baseball, if a pitcher whiffs a batter, they cause them to strike out (= to lose their turn because they have failed three times to hit the ball successfully): Jordan whiffed Sims with a high fastball. He whiffed eight batters in six innings.
